im.ecology.grassland.livestock.introduct.examplecitation: The implementation of Puerto model @cite(Busqué2014) , referred to as the Pasture and Livestock (PaL) module(s), into a semantic-first modelling approach designed to make models and their results more accessible to end-users such as farmers, and policy-makers. PaL is written in k.IM: a semantic modelling language designed for the k.LAB modelling platform powered by artificial intelligence, and in particular machine reasoning, for the interoperability of data and models @cite(Villa2017) .

im.ecology.grassland.livestock.vegetatio.examplecitation:
## Limiting Factor of Vegetation Growth
The vegetation growth limitation module is mainly composed of three models, with the possibility of adding a fourth one. The first three are closely linked to climatic factors, such as atmospheric temperature, soil moisture and incidence of solar radiation. The fourth limitation is linked to the nitrogen content in the soil that can be accessed by plants.
